user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CondVarUnlock_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarUnlock_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int                                status;
    OS_impl_condvar_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_condvar_table, *token);

    status = pthread_mutex_unlock(&impl->mut);
    if (status != 0)
    {
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CondVarUnlock_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_condvar_internal_record_t OS_impl_condvar_table[OS_MAX_CONDVARS]
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_mutex_t mut;
    pthread_cond_t  cv;
} OS_impl_condvar_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler-specific language extensions are used in the provided code. The function and related symbols use standard C constructs and POSIX APIs (pthread types and functions), standard typedefs (int32_t), and ordinary macros. There are no occurrences of known compiler extensions such as __attribute__, __asm__, __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, or other vendor-specific language features that compiler documentation would mark as extensions. The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET uses the address-of operator on the macro parameter (&(tok)) which can be risky if the actual argument has side effects, but that is not a compiler language extension and thus is not reportable under MISRA C:2023 Rule 1.2.
